document_title: Hepatitis A: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Hepatitis A (hepatitis A) is an acute liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus (HAV). The disease causes damage to liver epithelial cells, affecting liver activity and function.
According to the World Health Organization (WHO), each year there are about 1.4 million cases of hepatitis A in the world. This form of hepatitis is easily spread through contaminated food or water. Most people with hepatitis A recover within a few months and do not develop any serious health problems. (2)
